block.p: Jill Christina Morrison, a lawyer, and Malik Chaka Edwards, a graduate student, were married yesterday at B. Smith's Restaurant in Washington. Judge Sterling Johnson Jr. of Federal District Court in Brooklyn officiated.

Ms. Morrison, 29, is keeping her name. She is a lawyer at the National Women's Law Center, an advocacy organization in Washington. She graduated from Rutgers University and the Yale Law School. She is a daughter of Hilda E. Wilkins of Virginia Beach and James C. Morrison of La Porte, Tex., and a stepdaughter of Helen Morrison and of Joseph P. Wilkins.

Jill Christina Morrison, a lawyer, and Malik Chaka Edwards, a graduate student, were married yesterday at B. Smith's Restaurant in Washington. Judge Sterling Johnson Jr. of Federal District Court in Brooklyn officiated.

Ms. Morrison, 29, is keeping her name. She is a lawyer at the National Women's Law Center, an advocacy organization in Washington. She graduated from Rutgers University and the Yale Law School. She is a daughter of Hilda E. Wilkins of Virginia Beach and James C. Morrison of La Porte, Tex., and a stepdaughter of Helen Morrison and of Joseph P. Wilkins.

Mr. Morrison, 31, is taking the bride's surname. He graduated from Oberlin College and received a law degree from New York University, and is now a doctoral candidate in educational policy at the University of Pennsylvania. He is a son of Malik M. Chaka of Silver Spring, Md., who changed his name, and Cheryl E. Amana of Durham, N.C., and a stepson of Brenda Chaka.
